intro: Exacum horsfieldianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of velvety, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, typically clustered in a terminal inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom continuously throughout the year under proper care.
